question: Do IEG create a ripple effect of transcription?
ideal_answer: Rapid induction of immediate-early genes (IEGs) in response to growth factor stimulations is accompanied by co-upregulation of their neighbouring genes.

snippets.text: Rapid induction of immediate-early genes (IEGs) in response to growth factor stimulations is accompanied by co-upregulation of their neighbouring genes.
Even in surrounding intergenic regions, transcriptional activation took place at the same time.
Here we show that intensive transcription at one locus frequently spills over into its physical neighbouring loci.
